definition: to start out by/to grow an enterprise beginning with/to begin one's career by

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
to build up from nothing/to start from scratch
to rise up by thrift and hard work (idiom)
to start from scratch (idiom)

sentences.english: And therein lies the problem for this self-made billionaire.
sentences.chinese: 這個白手起家的億萬富翁也面臨着問題。

sentences.english: A lot of rock stars started out playing in garage bands before they got big.
sentences.chinese: 許多著名的搖滾樂手是從車庫樂隊起家的。

sentences.english: Samsung began as a small noodle business in 1938.
sentences.chinese: 早在1938年，三星乾麪粉行業起家。

sentences.english: Cai says his Horatio Alger story is “typical of Wenzhou.
sentences.chinese: 蔡說，他的白手起家的故事是一個”溫州的典型“。

sentences.english: National Pingtung University of Science and Technology (NPUST) was first founded in 1924 as an agricultural high school.
sentences.chinese: 國立屏東科技大學創校於1924年，以農校起家。

sentences.english: That was how my style got started.
sentences.chinese: 我的風格就是這樣起家的。

sentences.english: She came to this country, and she started a laundry business from nothing.
sentences.chinese: 她來到這個國家，白手起家，辦起洗衣店。

sentences.english: She started off making gowns and lingerie in her home.
sentences.chinese: 羅莎麗亞靠製造睡衣和內衣起家。

sentences.english: He baked the torte from scratch.
sentences.chinese: 他從烤果子奶油蛋糕白手起家。

sentences.english: Both firms' founders were early practitioners of the lean startup method.
sentences.chinese: 兩家公司的創辦者是薄本起家方法的早期實踐者。

sentences.english: Wong Kwong Yu about how to start their own has been a closely-guarded secret.
sentences.chinese: 黃光裕對於自己如何起家，一直諱莫如深。

sentences.english: Smith has worked the firm up from almost nothing.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯幾乎是白手起家，搞起了這家公司。

sentences.english: Inventing such a camera wouldn't be easy, but Cameron said he wasreadyto break new ground.
sentences.chinese: 發明這種像機絕非易事，但卡梅隆決定白手起家。

sentences.english: They've been created from scratch and they're very successful.
sentences.chinese: 他們是白手起家的，現在很成功。

sentences.english: The beauty of starting a Web business is that you can do it on a shoestring.
sentences.chinese: 創辦網絡的好處在於你可以白手起家。

sentences.english: Before liberation few workers could support their families.
sentences.chinese: 解放前幾乎沒有工人能養得起家。

definition: to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
to make one's mark/to go up in the world/to make one's fortune
to seize power/to conquer the world/to establish and expand a business/to carve out a career for oneself
to set foot in/to step into/to become involved for the first time
to build up from nothing/to start from scratch
to establish/to set up/to found
big boss/leader of a group/dominant (position)
to be born of/to come from/family background/class origin
to march/to advance
early years/adolescence
the first pot of gold/the initial profits from an economic endeavour
arrogant/to put on airs/(business etc) to expand/to enlarge/to do sth on a big scale
business/CL:筆|笔[bi3]
life force/vitality
main business
nouveau riche/upstart/new appointee
to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
